de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.constraint.analysis

Class Term

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.constraint.analysis.Term
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class Term
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Term represents a mathematical term in a (linear) pseudo-boolean restriction. The class describes terms like a*x_id where a is an integer unequal 0, and id an integer greater 0. Additionally, the value of the boolean variable x_id can be inverted.
    Author:
    Sebastian Henneberg

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Term(int id, int coefficient, boolean positive)
      Creates a new linear term with specified id and coefficient.
      Term(Term term)
      Creates a new linear term using the same state than the passed instance.

      • Term

        public Term(int id,
            int coefficient,
            boolean positive)
        Creates a new linear term with specified id and coefficient.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique identification of the unknown boolean variable.
        coefficient - The coefficient of the term.
        positive - False if the unknown boolean variable is negated.
